column4: DHCP = basically random ips in a set range determined by your router. Lease = the current ip "assigned" to you. lease is used when that ip expires. sorta like "rent" the ip
im no linux expert but either DHCP isnt setup correctly on your PC or something isnt set with your router
you dont really NEED dhcp. as logn as you set the ip/subnet/gateway/dns correctly to an ip cupported by the router and point dns/gateway to the router
router is working fine. i'm using it right now... DHCP setup? how to do this? I am using dhcp now on this machine... don't know why ubuntu machine won't get dhcp lease
